title: The Jerusalem Bible (Catholic) (pdf)
description:
Alexander Jones, ed. - The Jerusalem Bible: Reader's Edition (Doubleday, 1966). 1722 pages.

New scan. Searchable pdf (clearscan) with contents in bookmarks, accurate pagination and metadata, etc.

As far as I know, this is the first time the complete Jerusalem Bible has been made available in digital form. The edition used is that of the "Reader's Edition," so it does not contain the full array of footnotes used in the first edition, but the Bible text itself is complete and includes the full Roman Catholic canon.


The Jerusalem Bible was one of the first, and was the most important, modern translation of the Bible for Catholics, and is still used in the lectionary for the Catholic Church in the UK. It may be worth noting that J. R. R. Tolkien was among the translators of the Old Testament.
